pr_title: [ML] Delete DF analytics stats upon job deletion

timeline.message:
[ML] Delete DF analytics stats upon job deletion

Since a data frame analytics job may have associated docs
in the .ml-stats-* indices, when the job is deleted we
should delete those docs too.

timeline.bodyText: Oddly this returns 0 hits when run with security. I can't see any difference between the .ml-stats and the .ml-state indices. The same search is done for the latter just before and it works fine. I tried adding the header and that fixes it. But it's not needed when searching the state index. Any ideas @droberts195 ?
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
There is some difference between security and no-security cases when it comes to hidden indices wildcard expansion.
Having said that, I don't understand the difference between .ml-state* and .ml-stats-* as both are hidden...
replies.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText:
I think you should give the machine_learning_admin role read and view_index_metadata privileges on the .ml-stats* pattern.
machine_learning_admin has read access to the .ml-state* pattern, so that is the difference.
